085/**
086 * A utility class providing useful operations related to Java {@link
087 * Type}s.
088 *
089 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
090 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
091 */
092public final class JavaTypes {

096   * Static fields.

104   * Constructors.
105   */

109    super();
110  }

114   * Static methods.

118  /**
119   * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
120   * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
121   * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
122   * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
123   * the {@link CovariantSemantics} class.
124   *
125   * <p>This method calls {@link CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type,
126   * Type)} with the supplied arguments and returns the result.</p>
127   *
128   * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
129   * not be {@code null}
130   *
131   * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
132   * not be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the type
135   * modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable to a
136   * reference bearing the type modeled by the {@link
137   * CovariantSemantics} class
138   *
139   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
140   * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
141   *
142   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
143   *
144   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
145   * threads.
146   *
147   * @see CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
148   */
149  @Convenience
150  public static final boolean assignable(final Type receiverType, final Type payloadType) {
151    return CovariantSemantics.INSTANCE.assignable(receiverType, payloadType);
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
156   * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
157   * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
158   * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
159   * the {@link CovariantSemantics} class.
160   *
161   * <p>This method calls {@link CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type,
162   * Type, boolean)} with the supplied arguments and returns the
163   * result.</p>
164   *
165   * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
166   * not be {@code null}
167   *
168   * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
169   * not be {@code null}
170   *
171   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
172   *
173   * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the type
174   * modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable to a
175   * reference bearing the type modeled by the {@link
176   * CovariantSemantics} class
177   *
178   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
179   * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
180   *
181   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
182   *
183   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
184   * threads.
185   *
186   * @see CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
187   */
188  @Convenience
189  public static final boolean assignable(final Type receiverType, final Type payloadType, final boolean box) {
190    return CovariantSemantics.INSTANCE.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, box);
191  }

193  /**
194   * Returns a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}.
195   *
196   * @return a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}
197   *
198   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
199   *
200   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic
201   *
202   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
203   * threads.
204   */
205  public static final Type[] emptyTypeArray() {
206    return EMPTY_TYPE_ARRAY;
207  }

209  /**
210   * Returns the <em>direct supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
211   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
212   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
213   * TypeVariable}.
214   *
215   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type
216   * itself.</p>
217   *
218   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
219   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
220   * implementation.</p>
221   *
222   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
223   * null}
224   *
225   * @return a {@link Collection} of the direct supertypes of the
226   * supplied {@code type}; never {@code null}
227   *
228   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
229   *
230   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
231   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
232   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
233   *
234   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
235   *
236   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
237   *
238   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
239   * threads.
240   */
241  public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Type type) {
242    if (Objects.requireNonNull(type) instanceof Class<?> c) {
243      return directSupertypes(c);
244    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
245      return directSupertypes(p);
246    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
247      return directSupertypes(g);
248    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
249      return directSupertypes(tv);
250    } else {
251      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
252    }
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Returns the <em>direct supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
257   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
258   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
259   * TypeVariable}.
260   *
261   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type
262   * itself.</p>
263   *
264   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
265   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
266   * implementation.</p>
267   *
268   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
269   * null}
270   *
271   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
272   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
273   * must not be {@code null}
274   *
275   * @return a {@link Collection} of the direct supertypes of the
276   * supplied {@code type}; never {@code null}
277   *
278   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code type} or {@code
279   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}.
280   *
281   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
282   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
283   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
284   *
285   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
286   *
287   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
288   *
289   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
290   * threads.
291   */
292  public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Type type,
293                                                                  final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
294    final ArrayList<Type> c = new ArrayList<>(11);
295    for (final Type ds : directSupertypes(type)) {
296      if (acceptancePredicate.test(ds)) {
297        c.add(ds);
298      }
299    }
300    c.trimToSize();
301    return c.isEmpty() ? List.of() : Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
302  }
303  
304  static final <T> boolean acceptAll(final T type) {
305    return true;
306  }
307
308  static final <T> boolean acceptAll(final T subtype, final T supertype) {
309    return true;
310  }
311
312  private static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Class<?> c) {
313    if (c == Object.class) {
314      return List.of();
315    } else if (c.isPrimitive()) {
316      // 4.10.1. Subtyping among Primitive Types
317      //
318      // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
319      // among the primitive types:
320      //
321      // double >‚ÇÅ float
322      //
323      // float >‚ÇÅ long
324      //
325      // long >‚ÇÅ int
326      //
327      // int >‚ÇÅ char
328      //
329      // int >‚ÇÅ short
330      //
331      // short >‚ÇÅ byte
332      //
333      // [We skip all this.]
334      return List.of();
335    } else {
336      final ArrayList<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
337      final Class<?> componentType = c.getComponentType();
338      if (componentType == null) {
339        final Type[] parameters = c.getTypeParameters();
340        if (parameters.length > 0) {
341          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
342          //
343          // [‚Ä¶]
344          //
345          // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
346          // F‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,F‚Çô (ùëõ > 0), the direct supertypes of the [this]
347          // raw type C (¬ß4.8) are all of the following:
348          //
349          // The erasure (¬ß4.6) of the direct superclass type of C, if
350          // C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
351          //
352          // The erasure of the direct superinterface types of C.
353          //
354          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
355          // superinterface types.
356          final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = c.getSuperclass(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
357          if (directSuperclassTypeErasure != null) {
358            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassTypeErasure);
359          }
360          final Class<?>[] directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures = c.getInterfaces(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
361          if (directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures.length > 0) {
362            for (final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure : directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures) {
363              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure);
364            }
365          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
366            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
367          }
368        } else {
369          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
370          //
371          // Given a non-generic class or interface C, the direct
372          // supertypes of the type of C are all of the following:
373          //
374          // The direct superclass type of C (¬ß8.1.4), if C is a class.
375          //
376          // The direct superinterface types of C (¬ß8.1.5, ¬ß9.1.3).
377          //
378          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
379          // superinterface types (¬ß9.1.3).
380          final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass(); // let the JDK construct what may be either a Class or a ParameterizedType
381          if (directSuperclassType != null) {
382            assert (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType;
383            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassType);
384          }
385          final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces(); // let the JDK construct what may be either Class or ParameterizedType instances
386          if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
387            for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
388              assert (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType;
389              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceType);
390            }
391          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
392            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
393          }
394        }
395      } else {
396        // 4.10.3. Subtyping among Array Types
397        //
398        // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
399        // among array types:
400        //
401        // If S and T are both reference types, then S[] >‚ÇÅ T[] iff
402        // S >‚ÇÅ T.
403        //
404        // Object >‚ÇÅ Object[]
405        //
406        // Cloneable >‚ÇÅ Object[]
407        //
408        // java.io.Serializable >‚ÇÅ Object[]
409        //
410        // If P is a primitive type, then:
411        //
412        // Object >‚ÇÅ P[]
413        //
414        // Cloneable >‚ÇÅ P[]
415        //
416        // java.io.Serializable >‚ÇÅ P[]
417        if (componentType == Object.class || componentType.isPrimitive()) {
418          // Object[] or, say, int[]
419          directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
420          directSupertypes.add(Cloneable.class);
421          directSupertypes.add(Serializable.class);
422        } else {
423          // Reference type (which could be a Class or a ParameterizedType).
424          for (final Type componentTypeDirectSupertype : directSupertypes(componentType)) {
425            directSupertypes.add(array(componentTypeDirectSupertype));
426          }
427        }
428      }
429      directSupertypes.trimToSize();
430      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
431    }
432  }
433
434  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final ParameterizedType p) {
435    final ArrayList<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
436    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
437    //
438    // [‚Ä¶]
439    //
440    // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
441    // F‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,F‚Çô (ùëõ > 0), the direct supertypes of the parameterized
442    // type C<T‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,T‚Çô>, where each of T·µ¢ (1 ‚â§ ùëñ ‚â§ ùëõ) is a type, are
443    // all of the following:
444    //
445    // The substitution [F‚ÇÅ:=T‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,F‚Çô:=T‚Çô] applied to the direct
446    // superclass type of C, if C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
447    //
448    // The substitution [F‚ÇÅ:=T‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,F‚Çô:=T‚Çô] applied to the direct
449    // superinterface types of C.
450    //
451    // C<S‚ÇÅ,‚Ä¶,S‚Çô>, where S·µ¢ contains T·µ¢ (1 ‚â§ ùëñ ‚â§ ùëõ) (¬ß4.5.1) [we're
452    // going to skip this].
453    //
454    // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
455    // superinterface types.
456    //
457    // The raw type C.
458    final Class<?> c = erase(p.getRawType());
459    final Type[] typeArguments = p.getActualTypeArguments();
460    final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass();
461    if (directSuperclassType != null) {
462      if (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
463        final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
464        assert directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
465        assert typeArguments.length == directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
466        directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperclassTypeErasure, typeArguments));
467      } else if (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericClass) {
468        assert nonGenericClass.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
469        directSupertypes.add(nonGenericClass);
470      } else {
471        throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType);
472      }
473    }
474    final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces();
475    if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
476      for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
477        if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
478          final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
479          assert directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
480          assert typeArguments.length == directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
481          directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure, typeArguments));
482        } else if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericInterface) {
483          assert nonGenericInterface.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
484          directSupertypes.add(nonGenericInterface);
485        } else {
486          throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType);
487        }
488      }
489    } else if (c.isInterface()) {
490      directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
491    }
492    directSupertypes.add(c);
493    directSupertypes.trimToSize();
494    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
495  }
496
497  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final GenericArrayType g) {
498    final Collection<? extends Type> genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes = directSupertypes(g.getGenericComponentType());
499    final Collection<Type> returnValue = new ArrayList<>(genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes.size());
500    for (final Type ds : genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes) {
501      returnValue.add(array(ds));
502    }
503    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(returnValue);
504  }
505
506  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
507    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
508    //
509    // [‚Ä¶]
510    //
511    // The direct supertypes of a type variable are the types listed
512    // in its bound.
513    return List.of(tv.getBounds());
514  }
515
516  /**
517   * Returns the <em>supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
518   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
519   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
520   * TypeVariable}.
521   *
522   * <p><strong>The supertypes of a type include the type
523   * itself.</strong></p>
524   *
525   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
526   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
527   * implementation.</p>
528   *
529   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
530   * null}
531   *
532   * @return a {@link Collection} of the supertypes of the supplied
533   * {@code type}; never {@code null}
534   *
535   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
536   *
537   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
538   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
539   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
540   *
541   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
542   *
543   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
544   *
545   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
546   * threads.
547   */
548  public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type) {
549    return supertypes0(type, new HashSet<>()::add);
550  }
551
552  /**
553   * Returns the <em>supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
554   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
555   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
556   * TypeVariable}.
557   *
558   * <p><strong>The supertypes of a type include the type
559   * itself.</strong></p>
560   *
561   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
562   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
563   * implementation.</p>
564   *
565   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
566   * null}
567   *
568   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
569   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
570   * must not be {@code null}
571   *
572   * @return a {@link Collection} of the supertypes of the supplied
573   * {@code type}; never {@code null}
574   *
575   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code type} or {@code
576   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}.
577   *
578   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
579   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
580   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
581   *
582   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
583   *
584   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
585   *
586   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
587   * threads.
588   */
589  public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type, final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
590    final ArrayList<Type> c = new ArrayList<>(11);
591    for (final Type st : supertypes(type)) {
592      if (acceptancePredicate.test(st)) {
593        c.add(st);
594      }
595    }
596    c.trimToSize();
597    return c.isEmpty() ? List.of() : Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
598  }
599
600  private static final Collection<Type> supertypes0(final Type type, final Predicate<? super JavaType> unseen) {
601    if (unseen.test(JavaType.of(type))) {
602      final ArrayList<Type> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
603      supertypes.add(type); // reflexive
604      for (final Type ds : directSupertypes(type)) {
605        supertypes.addAll(supertypes0(ds, unseen)); // transitive/recursive
606      }
607      supertypes.trimToSize();
608      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(supertypes);
609    } else {
610      return List.of();
611    }
612  }
613
614  /**
615   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
616   * {@code sub}.
617   *
618   * <p>This method obeys the <a
619   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10"
620   * target="_parent">subtyping rules from the Java Language
621   * Specification</a> with the following exceptions:</p>
622   *
623   * <ul>
624   *
625   * <li><a
626   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1"
627   * target="_parent">Containing types</a> are discarded when
628   * calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.</li>
629   *
630   * <li>{@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() Primitive types} have no
631   * supertypes.</li>
632   *
633   * </ul>
634   *
635   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
636   *
637   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
638   *
639   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
640   * {@code sub}
641   *
642   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code
643   * null}
644   *
645   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
646   *
647   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
648   * threads.
649   *
650   * @see #supertypes(Type)
651   */
652  public static final boolean supertype(final Type sup, final Type sub) {
653    return supertype(sup, sub, null);
654  }
655
656  /**
657   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
658   * {@code sub}.
659   *
660   * <p>This method obeys the <a
661   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10"
662   * target="_parent">subtyping rules from the Java Language
663   * Specification</a> with the following exceptions:</p>
664   *
665   * <ul>
666   *
667   * <li><a
668   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1"
669   * target="_parent">Containing types</a> are discarded when
670   * calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.</li>
671   *
672   * <li>{@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() Primitive types} have no
673   * supertypes.</li>
674   *
675   * </ul>
676   *
677   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
678   *
679   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
680   *
681   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling which
682   * supertypes are considered in this method's calculation; may be
683   * {@code null} in which case all supertypes will be considered
684   *
685   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
686   * {@code sub}
687   *
688   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code sup} or {@code
689   * sub} is {@code null}
690   *
691   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
692   *
693   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
694   * threads.
695   *
696   * @see #supertypes(Type, Predicate)
697   */
698  public static final boolean supertype(final Type sup, final Type sub, Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
699    // Is sup a supertype of sub?
700    Objects.requireNonNull(sup, "sup");
701    Objects.requireNonNull(sub, "sub");
702    final boolean acceptAll;
703    if (acceptancePredicate == null) {
704      acceptancePredicate = JavaTypes::acceptAll;
705      acceptAll = true;
706    } else {
707      acceptAll = acceptancePredicate == (Predicate<? super Type>)JavaTypes::acceptAll;
708    }
709    if (acceptAll || acceptancePredicate.test(sup) && acceptancePredicate.test(sub)) {
710      if (equals(sup, sub)) {
711        return true;
712      } else if (acceptAll && sup instanceof Class<?> supC && sub instanceof Class<?> subC) {
713        // Easy optimization
714        return supC.isAssignableFrom(subC);
715      } else {
716        for (final Type supertype : supertypes(sub, acceptancePredicate)) {
717          if (equals(supertype, sup)) {
718            return true;
719          }
720        }
721      }
722    }
723    return false;
724  }
725
726  private static final Type array(final Type type) {
727    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-10.html#jls-10.1
728    // 10.1 Array Types
729    // ‚Ä¶
730    // The element type of an array may be any type, whether
731    // primitive or reference.
732    // ‚Ä¶
733    // [That rules out wildcards, but nothing else.]
734    if (type == null) {
735      throw new NullPointerException("type");
736    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
737      return c.arrayType();
738    } else if (!(type instanceof WildcardType)) {
739      return new DefaultGenericArrayType(type);
740    } else {
741      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
742    }
743  }
744
745  static final boolean isReferenceType(final Type type) {
746    // Wildcards are ruled out by the BNF in
747    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1
748    return !(type == null || type instanceof WildcardType || (type instanceof Class<?> c && c.isPrimitive()));
749  }
750
751  /**
752   * Returns the type erasure for the supplied {@link Type} according
753   * to <a
754   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6"
755   * target="_parent">the rules of the Java Language
756   * Specification, section 4.6</a>.
757   *
758   * <ul>
759   *
760   * <li>If {@code null} is supplied, {@code null} is returned.</li>
761   *
762   * <li>If a {@link Class} is supplied, the {@link Class} is returned.</li>
763   *
764   * <li>If a {@link ParameterizedType} is supplied, the result of
765   * invoking {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
766   * ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type} is returned.</li>
767   *
768   * <li>If a {@link GenericArrayType} is supplied, the result of
769   * invoking {@link Object#getClass()} on an invocation of {@link
770   * java.lang.reflect.Array#newInstance(Class, int)} with the return
771   * value of an invocation of {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
772   * GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType() generic component
773   * type} and {@code 0} as its arguments is returned.</li>
774   *
775   * <li>If a {@link TypeVariable} is supplied, the result of invoking
776   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
777   * TypeVariable#getBounds() first (leftmost) bound}</strong> is
778   * returned (if it has one) or {@link Object Object.class} if it
779   * does not.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
780   *
781   * <li>If a {@link WildcardType} is supplied, the result of invoking
782   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
783   * WildcardType#getUpperBounds() first upper bound}</strong> is
784   * returned.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
785   *
786   * </ul>
787   *
788   * @param type the {@link Type} for which the corresponding type
789   * erasure is to be returned; may be {@code null} in which case
790   * {@code null} will be returned
791   *
792   * @return a {@link Class}, or {@code null} if a suitable {@link
793   * Class}-typed type erasure could not be determined, indicating
794   * that the type erasure is the supplied {@link Type} itself
795   *
796   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
797   *
798   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple
799   * threads.
800   *
801   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
802   */
803  public static final Class<?> erase(final Type type) {
804    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
805    // 4.6. Type Erasure
806    //
807    // Type erasure is a mapping from types (possibly including
808    // parameterized types and type variables) to types (that are
809    // never parameterized types or type variables). We write |T| for
810    // the erasure of type T. The erasure mapping is defined as
811    // follows:
812    //
813    // The erasure of a parameterized type (¬ß4.5) G<T1,‚Ä¶,Tn> is |G|.
814    //
815    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is |T|.C.
816    //
817    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[].
818    //
819    // The erasure of a type variable (¬ß4.4) is the erasure of its
820    // leftmost bound.
821    //
822    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself.
823    if (type == null) {
824      return null;
825    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
826      return erase(c);
827    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
828      return erase(p);
829    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
830      return erase(g);
831    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
832      return erase(tv);
833    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
834      return erase(w);
835    } else {
836      return null;
837    }
838  }
839
840  private static final Class<?> erase(final Class<?> type) {
841    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
842    // ‚Ä¶
843    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is
844    // |T|.C. [Class.getDeclaringClass() returns an already erased
845    // type.]
846    //
847    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [A Class that is an
848    // array has a Class as its component type, and that is already
849    // erased.]
850    // ‚Ä¶
851    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself. [So in all
852    // cases we can just return the supplied Class<?>.]
853    return type;
854  }
855
856  private static final Class<?> erase(final ParameterizedType type) {
857    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
858    // ‚Ä¶
859    // The erasure of a parameterized type (¬ß4.5) G<T1,‚Ä¶,T‚Çô> is |G|
860    // [|G| means the erasure of G, i.e. the erasure of
861    // type.getRawType()].
862    return erase(type.getRawType());
863  }
864
865  private static final Class<?> erase(final GenericArrayType type) {
866    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
867    //
868    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [|T| means the
869    // erasure of T. We erase the genericComponentType() and use
870    // Class#arrayType() to find the "normal" array class for the
871    // erasure.]
872    final Class<?> componentType = erase(type.getGenericComponentType());
873    if (componentType == null) {
874      return null;
875    } else {
876      return componentType.arrayType();
877    }
878  }
879
880  private static final Class<?> erase(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
881    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
882    //
883    // The erasure of a type variable (¬ß4.4) is the erasure of its
884    // leftmost bound. [In the case of a TypeVariable<?> that returns
885    // multiple bounds, we know they will start with a class, not an
886    // interface and not a type variable.]
887    final Type[] bounds = type.getBounds();
888    return bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
889  }
890
891  private static final Class<?> erase(final WildcardType type) {
892    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
893    //
894    // The erasure of a type variable (¬ß4.4) is the erasure of its
895    // leftmost bound.  [WildcardTypes aren't really in the JLS per se
896    // but they behave like type variables. Only upper bounds will
897    // matter here.]
898    final Type[] bounds = type.getUpperBounds();
899    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
900  }
901
902  /**
903   * Tests two {@link Type}s for equality in a manner that is
904   * independent of their implementations.
905   *
906   * @param type0 the first {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
907   *
908   * @param type1 the second {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
909   *
910   * @return {@code true} if the two {@link Type}s are equal; {@code
911   * false} otherwise
912   *
913   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
914   * threads.
915   *
916   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
917   */
918  public static final boolean equals(final Type type0, final Type type1) {
919    if (type0 == null) {
920      return type1 == null;
921    } else if (type1 == null) {
922      return false;
923    } else if (type0 == type1) {
924      return true;
925    } else if (type0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
926      return type1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
927    } else if (type0 instanceof ParameterizedType p0) {
928      return type1 instanceof ParameterizedType p1 && equals(p0, p1);
929    } else if (type0 instanceof GenericArrayType g0) {
930      return type1 instanceof GenericArrayType g1 && equals(g0, g1);
931    } else if (type0 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv0) {
932      return type1 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv1 && equals(tv0, tv1);
933    } else if (type0 instanceof WildcardType w0) {
934      return type1 instanceof WildcardType w1 && equals(w0, w1);
935    } else {
936      return Objects.equals(type0, type1);
937    }
938  }
939
940  private static final boolean equals(final Type[] ts0, final Type[] ts1) {
941    if (ts0 == null) {
942      return ts1 == null;
943    } else if (ts1 == null) {
944      return false;
945    } else if (ts0 == ts1) {
946      return true;
947    } else if (ts0.length == ts1.length) {
948      for (final Type t0 : ts0) {
949        for (final Type t1 : ts1) {
950          if (!equals(t0, t1)) {
951            return false;
952          }
953        }
954      }
955      return true;
956    } else {
957      return false;
958    }
959  }
960
961  private static final boolean equals(final Class<?> c0, final Class<?> c1) {
962    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
963  }
964
965  private static final boolean equals(final ParameterizedType pt0, final ParameterizedType pt1) {
966    if (pt0 == null) {
967      return pt1 == null;
968    } else if (pt1 == null) {
969      return false;
970    } else if (pt0 == pt1) {
971      return true;
972    } else {
973      return
974        equals(pt0.getOwnerType(), pt1.getOwnerType()) &&
975        equals(pt0.getRawType(), pt1.getRawType()) &&
976        equals(pt0.getActualTypeArguments(), pt1.getActualTypeArguments());
977    }
978  }
979
980  private static final boolean equals(final GenericArrayType ga0, final GenericArrayType ga1) {
981    if (ga0 == null) {
982      return ga1 == null;
983    } else if (ga1 == null) {
984      return false;
985    } else if (ga0 == ga1) {
986      return true;
987    } else {
988      return equals(ga0.getGenericComponentType(), ga1.getGenericComponentType());
989    }
990  }
991
992  private static final boolean equals(final TypeVariable<?> tv0, final TypeVariable<?> tv1) {
993    if (tv0 == null) {
994      return tv1 == null;
995    } else if (tv1 == null) {
996      return false;
997    } else if (tv0 == tv1) {
998      return true;
999    } else {
1000      return
1001        equals(tv0.getGenericDeclaration(), tv1.getGenericDeclaration()) &&
1002        Objects.equals(tv0.getName(), tv1.getName());
1003    }
1004  }
1005
1006  private static final boolean equals(final GenericDeclaration gd0, final GenericDeclaration gd1) {
1007    if (gd0 == null) {
1008      return gd1 == null;
1009    } else if (gd1 == null) {
1010      return false;
1011    } else if (gd0 == gd1) {
1012      return true;
1013    } else if (gd0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
1014      return gd1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
1015    } else if (gd0 instanceof Executable e0) {
1016      return gd1 instanceof Executable e1 && equals(e0, e1);
1017    } else {
1018      return Objects.equals(gd0, gd1);
1019    }
1020  }
1021
1022  private static final boolean equals(final Executable e0, final Executable e1) {
1023    if (e0 == null) {
1024      return e1 == null;
1025    } else if (e1 == null) {
1026      return false;
1027    } else if (e0 == e1) {
1028      return true;
1029    } else if (e0 instanceof Constructor<?> c0) {
1030      return e1 instanceof Constructor<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
1031    } else if (e0 instanceof Method m0) {
1032      return e1 instanceof Method m1 && equals(m0, m1);
1033    } else {
1034      return Objects.equals(e0, e1);
1035    }
1036  }
1037
1038  private static final boolean equals(final Constructor<?> c0, final Constructor<?> c1) {
1039    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
1040  }
1041
1042  private static final boolean equals(final Method m0, final Method m1) {
1043    return Objects.equals(m0, m1);
1044  }
1045
1046  private static final boolean equals(final WildcardType w0, final WildcardType w1) {
1047    if (w0 == null) {
1048      return w1 == null;
1049    } else if (w1 == null) {
1050      return false;
1051    } else if (w0 == w1) {
1052      return true;
1053    } else {
1054      return
1055        equals(w0.getLowerBounds(), w1.getLowerBounds()) &&
1056        equals(w0.getUpperBounds(), w1.getUpperBounds());
1057    }
1058  }
1059
1060  /**
1061   * Computes and returns a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type} independent of
1062   * its implementation.
1063   *
1064   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in
1065   * which case {@code 0} will be returned
1066   *
1067   * @return a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}
1068   *
1069   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1070   * threads.
1071   *
1072   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1073   */
1074  public static final int hashCode(final Type type) {
1075    if (type == null) {
1076      return 0;
1077    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
1078      return hashCode(c);
1079    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1080      return hashCode(p);
1081    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1082      return hashCode(g);
1083    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1084      return hashCode(tv);
1085    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1086      return hashCode(w);
1087    } else {
1088      return type.hashCode();
1089    }
1090  }
1091
1092  private static final int hashCode(final Class<?> type) {
1093    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1094  }
1095
1096  private static final int hashCode(final ParameterizedType type) {
1097    if (type == null) {
1098      return 0;
1099    } else {
1100      return Arrays.hashCode(type.getActualTypeArguments()) ^ hashCode(type.getOwnerType()) ^ hashCode(type.getRawType());
1101    }
1102  }
1103
1104  private static final int hashCode(final GenericArrayType type) {
1105    return type == null ? 0 : Objects.hashCode(type.getGenericComponentType());
1106  }
1107
1108  private static final int hashCode(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
1109    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1110  }
1111
1112  private static final int hashCode(final WildcardType type) {
1113    return type == null ? 0 : Arrays.hashCode(type.getUpperBounds()) ^ Arrays.hashCode(type.getLowerBounds());
1114  }
1115
1116  /**
1117   * Returns a {@link String} representation of the supplied {@link
1118   * Type} that is independent of its implementation.
1119   *
1120   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
1121   *
1122   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in which
1123   * case "{@code null}" will be returned
1124   *
1125   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of the
1126   * supplied {@link Type}
1127   *
1128   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1129   *
1130   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1131   * threads.
1132   *
1133   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1134   */
1135  public static final String toString(final Type type) {
1136    if (type == null) {
1137      return "null";
1138    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
1139      return toString(c);
1140    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1141      return toString(p);
1142    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1143      return toString(g);
1144    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1145      return toString(tv);
1146    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1147      return toString(w);
1148    } else {
1149      return type.getTypeName();
1150    }
1151  }
1152
1153  private static final String toString(final Class<?> c) {
1154    return c == null ? "null" : c.getTypeName();
1155  }
1156
1157  private static final String toString(final ParameterizedType ptype) {
1158    if (ptype == null) {
1159      return "null";
1160    } else {
1161      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1162      final Type ownerType = ptype.getOwnerType();
1163      if (ownerType == null) {
1164        sb.append(toString(ptype.getRawType()));
1165      } else {
1166        sb.append(toString(ownerType)).append("$");
1167        final Type rawType = ptype.getRawType();
1168        if (ownerType instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1169          sb.append(toString(rawType).replace(toString(p.getRawType()) + "$", ""));
1170        } else if (rawType instanceof Class<?> c) {
1171          sb.append(c.getSimpleName());
1172        } else {
1173          sb.append(toString(rawType));
1174        }
1175      }
1176      final Type[] actualTypeArguments = ptype.getActualTypeArguments();
1177      if (actualTypeArguments != null && actualTypeArguments.length > 0) {
1178        final StringJoiner stringJoiner = new StringJoiner(", ", "<", ">");
1179        stringJoiner.setEmptyValue("");
1180        for (final Type actualTypeArgument : actualTypeArguments) {
1181          stringJoiner.add(toString(actualTypeArgument));
1182        }
1183        sb.append(stringJoiner.toString());
1184      }
1185      return sb.toString();
1186    }
1187  }
1188
1189  private static final String toString(final GenericArrayType gatype) {
1190    if (gatype == null) {
1191      return "null";
1192    } else {
1193      return toString(gatype.getGenericComponentType()) + "[]";
1194    }
1195  }
1196
1197  private static final String toString(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1198    return tv == null ? "null" : tv.getName();
1199  }
1200
1201  private static final String toString(final WildcardType wc) {
1202    if (wc == null) {
1203      return "null";
1204    } else {
1205      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("?");
1206      Type[] bounds = wc.getLowerBounds();
1207      if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0) {
1208        // Upper bounds only.
1209        bounds = wc.getUpperBounds();
1210        if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0 || Object.class.equals(bounds[0])) {
1211          bounds = null;
1212        } else {
1213          sb.append(" extends ");
1214        }
1215      } else {
1216        // Lower bounds only.
1217        sb.append(" super ");
1218      }
1219      if (bounds != null) {
1220        assert bounds.length > 0;
1221        final StringJoiner sj = new StringJoiner(" & ");
1222        for (final Type bound: bounds) {
1223          sj.add(String.valueOf(toString(bound)));
1224        }
1225        sb.append(sj.toString());
1226      }
1227      return sb.toString();
1228    }
1229  }
1230
1231  /**
1232   * Returns an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1233   * ConstantDesc}.
1234   *
1235   * @param constantDesc the {@link ConstantDesc} to represent; may be
1236   * {@code null}; if {@code null}, then an {@link Optional}
1237   * consisting of {@link java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs#NULL} will
1238   * be returned
1239   *
1240   * @return an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1241   * ConstantDesc}; never {@code null}; never {@linkplain
1242   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1243   *
1244   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1245   *
1246   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1247   *
1248   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1249   * threads.
1250   */
1251  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1252    return constantDesc == null ? Optional.of(NULL) : Optional.of(constantDesc);
1253  }
1254
1255  /**
1256   * Returns an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1257   * Constable}.
1258   *
1259   * @param constable the {@link Constable} to represent; may be
1260   * {@code null}; if {@code null}, then an {@link Optional}
1261   * consisting of {@link java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs#NULL} will
1262   * be returned
1263   *
1264   * @return an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1265   * Constable}; never {@code null}; possibly {@linkplain
1266   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1267   *
1268   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1269   *
1270   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1271   *
1272   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1273   * threads.
1274   */
1275  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Constable constable) {
1276    return constable == null ? Optional.of(NULL) : constable.describeConstable();
1277  }
1278
1279  /**
1280   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1281   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link Type}, or
1282   * an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>} if
1283   * there is no such descriptor.
1284   *
1285   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; must be either {@code
1286   * null}, a {@link ConstantDesc} itself, a {@link Constable}, a
1287   * {@link ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType}, a {@link
1288   * TypeVariable} or a {@link WildcardType}
1289   *
1290   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1291   * null}
1292   *
1293   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1294   *
1295   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1296   *
1297   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1298   * threads.
1299   *
1300   * @see Constable
1301   */
1302  public static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Type type) {
1303    if (type == null) {
1304      return Optional.of(NULL);
1305    } else if (type instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1306      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1307    } else if (type instanceof Constable constable) {
1308      return describeConstable(constable); // includes Class<?>
1309    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1310      return describeConstable(p);
1311    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1312      return describeConstable(g);
1313    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1314      return describeConstable(tv);
1315    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1316      return describeConstable(w);
1317    } else {
1318      return Optional.empty();
1319    }
1320  }
1321
1322  /**
1323   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1324   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1325   * ParameterizedType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1326   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1327   *
1328   * @param ptype the {@link ParameterizedType} in question; may be
1329   * {@code null}
1330   *
1331   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1332   * null}
1333   *
1334   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1335   *
1336   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1337   *
1338   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1339   * threads.
1340   *
1341   * @see Constable
1342   */
1343  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final ParameterizedType ptype) {
1344    if (ptype == null) {
1345      return Optional.of(NULL);
1346    } else if (ptype instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1347      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1348    } else if (ptype instanceof Constable constable) {
1349      return describeConstable(constable);
1350    } else {
1351      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> ownerType = describeConstable(ptype.getOwnerType());
1352      if (ownerType.isPresent()) {
1353        final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> rawType = describeConstable(ptype.getRawType());
1354        if (rawType.isPresent()) {
1355          final Type[] actualTypeArguments = ptype.getActualTypeArguments();
1356          final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = actualTypeArguments.length + 3;
1357          final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1358          bsmInvokeArguments[0] =
1359            MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
1360                                           CD_Type,
1361                                           CD_Type,
1362                                           CD_Type.arrayType());
1363          bsmInvokeArguments[1] = ownerType.orElseThrow();
1364          bsmInvokeArguments[2] = rawType.orElseThrow();
1365          for (int i = 3; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1366            final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(actualTypeArguments[i - 3]);
1367            if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1368              return Optional.empty();
1369            }
1370            bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1371          }
1372          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1373                                                         DEFAULT_NAME,
1374                                                         CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
1375                                                         bsmInvokeArguments));
1376        }
1377      }
1378      return Optional.empty();
1379    }
1380  }
1381
1382  /**
1383   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1384   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1385   * GenericArrayType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1386   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1387   *
1388   * @param g the {@link GenericArrayType} in question; may be
1389   * {@code null}
1390   *
1391   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1392   * null}
1393   *
1394   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1395   *
1396   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1397   *
1398   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1399   * threads.
1400   *
1401   * @see Constable
1402   */
1403  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final GenericArrayType g) {
1404    if (g == null) {
1405      return Optional.of(NULL);
1406    } else if (g instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1407      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1408    } else if (g instanceof Constable c) {
1409      return describeConstable(c);
1410    } else {
1411      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> genericComponentType = describeConstable(g.getGenericComponentType());
1412      if (genericComponentType.isPresent()) {
1413        return
1414          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1415                                                  DEFAULT_NAME,
1416                                                  CD_DefaultGenericArrayType,
1417                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_DefaultGenericArrayType,
1418                                                                                 CD_Type),
1419                                                  genericComponentType.orElseThrow()));
1420      }
1421      return Optional.empty();
1422    }
1423  }
1424
1425  /**
1426   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1427   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1428   * TypeVariable}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1429   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1430   *
1431   * @param tv the {@link TypeVariable} in question; may be {@code
1432   * null}
1433   *
1434   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1435   * null}
1436   *
1437   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1438   *
1439   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1440   *
1441   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1442   * threads.
1443   *
1444   * @see Constable
1445   */
1446  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1447    if (tv == null) {
1448      return Optional.of(NULL);
1449    } else if (tv instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1450      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1451    } else if (tv instanceof Constable constable) {
1452      return describeConstable(constable);
1453    } else {
1454      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> gd = describeConstable(tv.getGenericDeclaration());
1455      if (gd.isPresent()) {
1456        final String name = tv.getName();
1457        return
1458          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1459                                                  name,
1460                                                  CD_TypeVariable,
1461                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
1462                                                                            Bootstraps.CD_Bootstraps,
1463                                                                            "getTypeVariable",
1464                                                                            MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_TypeVariable,
1465                                                                                              CD_GenericDeclaration,
1466                                                                                              CD_String)),
1467                                                  gd.orElseThrow(),
1468                                                  name));
1469      }
1470      return Optional.empty();
1471    }
1472  }
1473
1474  /**
1475   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1476   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1477   * WildcardType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1478   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1479   *
1480   * @param w the {@link WildcardType} in question; may be {@code
1481   * null}
1482   *
1483   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1484   * null}
1485   *
1486   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1487   *
1488   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1489   *
1490   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1491   * threads.
1492   *
1493   * @see Constable
1494   */
1495  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final WildcardType w) {
1496    if (w == null) {
1497      return Optional.of(NULL);
1498    } else if (w instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1499      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1500    } else if (w instanceof Constable c) {
1501      return describeConstable(c);
1502    } else {
1503      final Type[] lowerBounds = w.getLowerBounds();
1504      if (lowerBounds.length <= 0) {
1505        final Type[] upperBounds = w.getUpperBounds();
1506        if (upperBounds.length <= 0 || (upperBounds.length == 1 && upperBounds[0] == Object.class)) {
1507          // Unbounded.
1508          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_GET_STATIC_FINAL,
1509                                                         "INSTANCE",
1510                                                         CD_WildcardType,
1511                                                         CD_UnboundedWildcardType));
1512        } else {
1513          // Upper bounded (extends).
1514          final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = upperBounds.length + 1;
1515          final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1516          bsmInvokeArguments[0] = MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_UpperBoundedWildcardType, CD_Type.arrayType());
1517          for (int i = 1; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1518            final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(upperBounds[i - 1]);
1519            if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1520              return Optional.empty();
1521            }
1522            bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1523          }
1524          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1525                                                         DEFAULT_NAME,
1526                                                         CD_UpperBoundedWildcardType,
1527                                                         bsmInvokeArguments));
1528        }
1529      } else {
1530        // Lower bounded.
1531        final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = lowerBounds.length + 1;
1532        final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1533        bsmInvokeArguments[0] = MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_LowerBoundedWildcardType, CD_Type.arrayType());
1534        for (int i = 1; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1535          final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(lowerBounds[i - 1]);
1536          if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1537            return Optional.empty();
1538          }
1539          bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1540        }
1541        return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1542                                                       DEFAULT_NAME,
1543                                                       CD_LowerBoundedWildcardType,
1544                                                       bsmInvokeArguments));
1545      }
1546    }
1547  }
1548
1549  /**
1550   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1551   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1552   * GenericDeclaration}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1553   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1554   *
1555   * @param gd the {@link GenericDeclaration} in question; must be
1556   * either {@code null}, a {@link Class}, a {@link Constructor} or a
1557   * {@link Method}
1558   *
1559   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1560   * null}
1561   *
1562   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1563   *
1564   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1565   *
1566   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1567   * threads.
1568   *
1569   * @see Constable
1570   */
1571  static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final GenericDeclaration gd) {
1572    if (gd instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1573      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1574    } else if (gd instanceof Constable constable) {
1575      // Includes Class<?>
1576      return describeConstable(constable);
1577    } else if (gd instanceof Constructor<?> c) {
1578      return describeConstable(c);
1579    } else if (gd instanceof Method m) {
1580      return describeConstable(m);
1581    } else {
1582      return Optional.empty();
1583    }
1584  }
1585
1586  /**
1587   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1588   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1589   * Constructor}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1590   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1591   *
1592   * @param constructor the {@link Constructor} in question; may be
1593   * {@code null}
1594   *
1595   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1596   * null}
1597   *
1598   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1599   *
1600   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1601   *
1602   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1603   * threads.
1604   *
1605   * @see Constable
1606   */
1607  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Constructor<?> constructor) {
1608    Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> c = null;
1609    try {
1610      c = MethodHandles.lookup().unreflectConstructor(constructor).describeConstable();
1611    } catch (final IllegalAccessException illegalAccessException) {
1612      c = Optional.empty();
1613    }
1614    if (c != null && c.isPresent()) {
1615      return
1616        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1617                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
1618                                                CD_Constructor,
1619                                                DMHD_REFLECT_AS,
1620                                                CD_Constructor,
1621                                                c.orElseThrow()));
1622    }
1623    return Optional.empty();
1624  }
1625
1626  /**
1627   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1628   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link Method},
1629   * or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>}
1630   * if there is no such descriptor.
1631   *
1632   * @param method the {@link Method} in question; may be {@code null}
1633   *
1634   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1635   * null}
1636   *
1637   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1638   *
1639   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1640   *
1641   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1642   * threads.
1643   *
1644   * @see Constable
1645   */
1646  static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Method method) {
1647    Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> m = null;
1648    try {
1649      m = MethodHandles.lookup().unreflect(method).describeConstable();
1650    } catch (final IllegalAccessException illegalAccessException) {
1651      m = Optional.empty();
1652    }
1653    if (m != null && m.isPresent()) {
1654      return
1655        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1656                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
1657                                                CD_Method,
1658                                                DMHD_REFLECT_AS,
1659                                                CD_Method,
1660                                                m.orElseThrow()));
1661    }
1662    return Optional.empty();
1663  }
1664
1665}
